column2: A  skid  mark  is  the  visible mark  left by  any  solid which moves  against another,
important  aspect  of trace  evidence  analysis  in  forensic  science  and
forensic  engineering.  Skid marks  caused by  tires  on roads  occur when a vehicle
wheel  stops  rolling  and  slides  or  spins  on  the  surface  of the  road.  Skid  marks
may  be  divided  into  "acceleration marks"  created on  acceleration,  if the  engine

column1: provides  more  power than the tire  can transmit;  "braking  marks,"  if the  brakes
